title: Do politicians really try to be bipartisan? - Quora

response.answer_text: Successful politicians know that they must be cordial with other politicians.  While “pundits” seem to argue for polarized politicians, the politicians themselves do not act in that manner. One should look at Sanders, for example.  He has worked with Republicans in the past in the Senate.  It is those who find positions acceptable to both parties who end up being effective. Partisan rhetoric is reserved for campaigns - but if they really acted that way within Congress, they would find they had no long term viability.
Mianstream Politicians? No. They prefer the juxtaposition stance because each side is so dug in at this point the trenches are too deep to properly fight. Third partiers tend to lean more bipartisan.
Will Carlson's post in No One Will Believe You
